00040 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;

00042 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({                  \
00043         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00044             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00045         _u._ull = (ull);                                \
00046         (h) = _u._s._h;                                 \
00047         (l) = _u._s._l;                                 \
00048         })
00049 
00050 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({                     \
00051         union { unsigned long long _ull;                \
00052             struct { u_long _h; u_long _l; } _s; } _u;  \
00053         _u._s._h = (h);                                 \
00054         _u._s._l = (l);                                 \
00055         _u._ull;                                        \
00056         })
00057 
00058 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(const unsigned long m0, 
00059                                               const unsigned long m1)
00060 {
00061     return (unsigned long long) m0 * m1;
00062 }
00063 
00064 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00065                                                const unsigned long uld,
00066                                                unsigned long *const rp)
00067 {
00068 #if defined(__KERNEL__) && BITS_PER_LONG == 32
00069     const unsigned long r = __div64_32(&ull, uld);
00070 #else /* !__KERNEL__ || BITS_PER_LONG == 64 */
00071     const unsigned long r = ull % uld;
00072     ull /= uld;
00073 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00074 
00075     if (rp)
00076         *rp = r;
00077 
00078     return ull;
00079 }
00080 
00081 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00082 
00083 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00084 
00085     /* Returns (int)i = (unsigned long long)i*(u_long)(mult)/(u_long)div. */
00086     const unsigned long long ull = rthal_ullmul(i, mult);
00087     return rthal_uldivrem(ull, div, NULL);
00088 }
00089 
00090 static inline __attribute_const__
00091 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00092                                    const unsigned long m,
00093                                    const unsigned long d)
00094 {
00095     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll, qh, rh, ql;
00096     unsigned long long th, tl;
00097 
00098     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00099     tl = rthal_ullmul(opl, m);
00100     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00101     th = rthal_ullmul(oph, m);
00102     th += tlh;
00103 
00104     qh = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, &rh);
00105     th = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, tll);
00106     ql = rthal_uldivrem(th, d, NULL);
00107     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00108 }
00109 
00110 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00111                                      unsigned long m,
00112                                      unsigned long d)
00113 {
00114 
00115     if(op < 0LL)
00116         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00117     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00118 }

00120 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00121 
00122     __asm__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00123     return 31 - ul;
00124 }

00137 static inline unsigned long long rthal_rdtsc (void) {
00138     unsigned long long t;

00143 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00144 
00145 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00146    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00147    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00148    instead. */
00149 
00150 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00151     return ((struct thread_info *)(adp_root->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00152 }
00153 
00154 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00155 
00156 {
00157     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00158     /* FIXME: r2 should be ok or even __adeos_current_threadinfo() - offsetof(THREAD) */
00159     
00160     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00161         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00162 
00163     return current;
00164 }
00165 
00166 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00167 
00168 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00169     return current;
00170 }
00171 
00172 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid) {
00173     return current;
00174 }
00175 
00176 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00178 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00179 {
00180     if(!delay) delay = 1;
00181 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00182     mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00183 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00184     set_dec(delay);
00185 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00186 }

00197 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00198 
00199 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00200     
00201     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00202        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00203        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00204        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/hal/fpu.S). */
00205 
00206     double fpr[32];
00207     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00208     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00209 
00210 } rthal_fpenv_t;
00211 
00212 void rthal_init_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00213 
00214 void rthal_save_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);
00215 
00216 void rthal_restore_fpu(rthal_fpenv_t *fpuenv);

00218 #ifndef CONFIG_SMP
00219 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) last_task_used_math
00220 #else /* CONFIG_SMP */
00221 #define rthal_get_fpu_owner(cur) ({                             \
00222     struct task_struct * _cur = (cur);                          \
00223     ((_cur->thread.regs && (_cur->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))   \
00224      ? _cur : NULL);                                            \
00225 })
00226 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00227     
00228 #define rthal_disable_fpu() ({                          \
00229     register long _msr;                                 \
00230     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00231     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00232                            : /* no output */            \
00233                            : "r"(_msr & ~(MSR_FP))      \
00234                            : "memory" );                \
00235 })
00236 
00237 #define rthal_enable_fpu() ({                           \
00238     register long _msr;                                 \
00239     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mfmsr %0" : "=r"(_msr) );   \
00240     __asm__ __volatile__ ( "mtmsr %0"                   \
00241                            : /* no output */            \
00242                            : "r"(_msr | MSR_FP)         \
00243                            : "memory" );                \
00244 })
00245 
00246 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
